intro: Promicrantha alyssifolia, commonly known as the hairy alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. Promicrantha alyssifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
